review:
i went into the movie blind, not knowing what to expect, except for the brief description of the movie on netflix. in summary, people in jungle, something kills them 1 by 1. got it. i was interested to see if this was a human killer or something supernatural.

the usual tropes are present. the only plane to the site only comes as and when, their phones has no network and the victims roster has the usual variety of characters such as the annoying one whom we will all hate, the meek one, the pretty one,  the angry one, etc. ok, so far so good. 

however, even without touching on the weak storyline or the poor pacing, one major issue i have with the movie is the camerawork. the repeated pan-and-zoom from a distance from the sky, tree, bush, ground seems to serve no real purpose. usually it ends up panning or zooming behind an object which blocks the characters from view. it felt that they just bought a camera that that this feature so they do it over and over and over again. if it is supposed to be an artistic camera shot as it comes from a weird angle, they got carried away with it. that kinda ruined the experience for me.

and the ending was at best anti-climatic or simply lazy.

3/10
